intro: Opercularia micromerioides, commonly known as the dwarf opercularia, is a species of lichen belonging to the family Teloschistaceae. It is characterized by its crustose growth form, forming a thin, dark, and often fissured thallus on rock surfaces. The lichen consists of a symbiotic partnership between a photosynthetic alga and a fungal component, which together enable it to thrive in harsh environments. It is typically found in temperate regions, growing on siliceous rock substrates. Due to its small size and specialized habitat, it is a relatively rare and understudied species within the lichen community.
